Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to verify the weight, size, and composition of the bell.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the bell shown in the viral videos is the same bell that will be installed in the Ram Temple, which is not accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the possibility that the bell shown in the videos may be a different bell made in Tamil Nadu, rather than the one made in Uttar Pradesh.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the bell shown in the videos is not the 2,100 kg bell made of eight different metals.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the capabilities of the bell by stating it can be heard up to 15 km without providing any evidence to support this claim.
Understate: No instances of understating biases are evident in the provided claim.
Falters at times: No instances of faltering biases are evident in the provided claim.
